title: Kabir Singh:Kareena Kapoor Khan Gives Her Two Cents On 'Kabir Singh,' Explains Why Its Popularity Seems Problematic
text:
In India, films spark debates every now, which paves the way for more controversies still. One of the most popular yet controversial films of the year was Kabir Singh.

Shahid Kapoor and Kiara Advani's film was touted as a blockbuster but that in no way reduced the amount of criticism that the film received for its 'problematic' characters.

Kareena Kapoor Khan recently spoke to Filmfare and gave her two cents on the topic. Even though she has yet to watch the film, she gave her views as an artist, after she gauged the film's popularity.

Expressing her views and talking about Kiara Advani's character Preeti, she explained why she ‘personally doesn't believe in a character like that.’

She said, "I haven’t seen the film. But clearly it hasn’t affected anything because the movie has made over Rs 300 crores. So, it’s a double-edged sword. Because there are people who are actually going to watch it and have found something that they love."

"Otherwise, it is not possible for it to have done so well. But I’m happy that people are talking about it and if you ask me, I don’t personally believe in a character like that because that’s not me as a person," she explained.

Describing the fact that it was problematic and that people who liked the film outnumbered those who raised valid concerns around the film, she added, “At the end of the day, it’s a film and it has worked. But I’m happy that people are talking about things and they want their voice to be heard. But they clearly are outnumbered by the people who have loved the film. That’s the reality which is sad."

On the work front, she has almost completed two decades in the industry and in one of her recent interviews, she said that was born to act and that she will hopefully do it till the end of her life.
